result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle Leigh Wittig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle Leigh Wittig was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Leigh Wittig

records.addlTxt: Ordered that the DOC will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision...
Letter from WI DOC w/Amendment to Judgment for Court's signature.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Partial Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held March 6, 2017.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Randtke confirms receipt of PSI and reviewed with his client, 1 correction, agent notes defendant is not eligible for CIP, but he is statutorily eligible for CIP.  No witness by either counsel.  State's argument - defendant has significant criminal history; outstanding case in EC Co. set for trial in April; was placed on probation before and revoked in 14CM20 & 14CM28; recommendation is probation with less jail time than previously got which don't understand; Mr. Wittig is violent; doesn't make any sense when previously revoked to put him back on probation; seriousness of his criminal behavior court should consider prison sentence and recommend 18 mos. IC, 2 yrs ES, 113 sentence credit.  Atty Randtke argues prison sentence not appropriate; next step is to work with him in the community; resources the department can help him with on the felony, not available on previous misdemeanor cases; recommendation 4-6 mos. in county jail and be on probation makes sense.  Defendant addresses court.  Court sentences defendant to 3 1/2 yrs. WI State Prison; 1 1/2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES consecutive to any other sentence; don't find defendant eligible for CIP; recommend ERP; credit for 113 days served; as convicted felon you may not possess a firearm; you may not vote or hold elective office; conditions of ES:  provide DNA sample; pay costs think $516; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by seeking F/T employment or education; advised of felony prohibitions; advised of appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs defendant will plead to count 1, State will dismiss remaining counts and request PSI.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  PLQ/WR form  filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Dismiss counts 2, 3, 4; order PSI.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests to be released for holidays and stay with family.  His father had elected he not live with him and said his mom should have him.  Mom was charged with hiding him and sentenced yesterday.  Note defendant's long criminal history, EC Co. strangulation as a repeater & battery charges, cash bond absolutely necessary.  Bond remains as set.
Plea hearing on January 17, 2017 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, and constitutional rights.  NGP entered on all counts.  Atty Randtke requests to address bond; requests Sign. Bond.  State concerned with same circumstances with his Mom charged with aiding him.  Court orders bond remain as presently set.  Referred to scheduling clerk for STC.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. files WOPH form with Court.  Court finds defendant's WOPH done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial.  DA files Information with the court.
S.M. is required to appear on 11/29/2016 at 1:15 pm
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel for defendant requests to address bond.  Requests a signature bond; he has ties to community; whole family lives here; if court won't, request a small cash bond.  Court entertains a surety bond and regular drug testing.  State notes that would be a minimum option; defendant has a warrant for his arrest; refused to cooperate with law enforcement; his mom told lies; he's being charged with an allegation of a violent crime, strangulation in Eau Claire Co.; if his father is more responsible than his mother and has assets to be placed on line to assure his return, if not I think we can be satisfied cash bond appropriate.  If the family is willing to take a change on him, that gives the court assurance that maybe he will come back.  Court orders bond can be posted in 1 of 2 ways, $2500 cash or posted with $2500 bond with his father. Michael Wittig as surety with addt'l conditions:  reside with his father; comply with random drug testing requested by law enforcement; no violations of law; no possession or consumption of controlled substance without a prescription.  DA to prepare the bond form or inform clerk and if father signs, 1. He's guarantees his son will show up for court and 2. He will have no violations of law.  Defendant waives TL for PH.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Kyle Leigh Wittig in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights and right to preliminary hearing w/in 10 days, 20 days if not.  State notes defendant's significant criminal history, 2 open cases, strangulation and battery in Eau Claire County; his history imposes significant danger to public; there was outstanding warrant at the time; cash bond necessary, recommend $2500.00.  Defendant asks for signature bond.  Court sets $2500.00 cash bond and set this matter for tomorrow @ 12:45 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 12:45 pm.
